did.abstract: Lisa Marshall Bashert is a lesbian feminist witch from Ypsilanti, Michigan. She was involved in various causes and local organizations, especially relating to gay-lesbian activism in Michigan. She is a graduate of the University of Michigan and a life-partner of Beth Bashert. The Bashert collection consists almost entirely of her journals which are a combination of diaries, musings and other personal reflections about such topics as her sexuality, her personal relationships, and her involvement in feminist, lesbian, and pagan organizations.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of Lisa Marshall Bashert (donor no. 9510) and came to the library in September 2004. Several additions to the collection have been received.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open only with the written permission of Lisa Marshall Bashert. The collection will be open without restriction upon her death.

userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Lisa Marshall Bashert Papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Lisa Marshall Bashert is a lesbian feminist witch from Ypsilanti, Michigan. She was involved in various causes and local organizations, especially relating to gay-lesbian activism in Michigan. She is a graduate of the University of Michigan and a life-partner of Beth Bashert.

scopecontent.p: The Bashert collection consists almost entirely of her journals which are a combination of diaries, musings and other personal reflections about such topics as her sexuality, her personal relationship, and her involvement in feminist, lesbian, and pagan organizations.

note.p: (also includes programs, writings, published materials, letters written, notes on classes taken, personal reflections, etc.)
